page.title: 18HOLME LACY -PEOPLE'S LIVES 4
page.content: Over half the people we spoke to go to {Hereford at least once a week,}but about 12% go{once a month or less. For entertainment,{watching television was most popular. A few people go to the{theatre,}and none to the{cinema. Not many said they go to a{pub,}and only two said they read{books. {Walking the dog, walking}in the countryside,{fishing, swimming, enjoying{hobbies at home, gardening, and playing{snooker}were mentioned. Just over half thought there was {enough to do locally}to entertain them, but nearly half thought there ought to be{more to do locally. Their ideas for more local activities included{live music, clubs or {societies}for people with hobbies, and village-based troops for{Brownies, {Cubs, and Scouts}for the children, who have to travel to meetings.
